Posts.Content: From what I read, at 73 and with a Gleason of 4+5, I am at the high end of the scale for RARP. Last year my brother, a forum member, had a successful procedure with Dr. Patel. Here's hoping my visit to Florida next month will have similar results. I look forward to skiing the bumps at Sunday River when I am 80 and the lift tickets are free.
Posts.Signature: PSA 2006/1.6 2007/2.5 2008/1.4 2012/2.9 2014 /3.1/3.9 2015/4.4/7.7 2016/4.5/6.3 8/25/2016 2.4 with bicalutamide 8/25/16 biopsy Gleason 3+4=7 9/26/16 2nd opinion Gleason 4+5=9 right lateral mid Dana-Farber 10/12/16 endorectal MRI: Prostate 2.5 x 4.2 x 3.9 cm 22mL 1.3 x 0.8 cm focal lesion no extraprostatic extension Nureovascular bundle: normal Seminal vesicles: normal Pelvic lymph nodes: normal Retroperitoneum: normal Bones: normal RARP scheduied Dec 2016 =
Posts.Title: 74, Gleason 9, going for surgery
